result.markdown:
--- title: "R is a great language" subtitle: "and the praise package is the best package" author: "gwynn and Patrick" institute: "Wharton School of Business" date: "2022-12-01" output: format: revealjs xaringan::moon_reader: css: xaringan-themer.css lib_dir: libs nature: ratio: "16:9" highlightStyle: solarized-dark highlightLines: true countIncrementalSlides: false --- ## A statement of the overall goal / research question Our project will demonstrate that the `praise` package is by far the best `R` package. # Section title # Hello World - Click the `Render` button to compile your presentation # Quarto - The presentation is created using the `quarto` package - Use `##` or `#` to start a new slide # incremental ::: incremental - Thing 1 - and another - the last thing - with math $\frac{1}{2}$ ::: # Layouts You can use plain text - or bullet points - another thing # Two columns ::: columns ::: {.column width="50%"} ![](img/confetti.jpg) ::: ::: {.column width="50%"} words here ::: ::: ## {background-image="img/confetti.jpg" background-size="contain"} # Code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # a boring regression model <- lm(price ~ carat, data = diamonds) ``` ::: # Plots ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](presentation_files/figure-revealjs/plot-titanic_modified-1.png){width=80%} ::: ::: ------------------------------------------------------------------------ # Tables If you want to generate a table, make sure it is in the HTML format (instead of Markdown or other formats), e.g., ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Name Sex Age Siblings/Spouses Aboard Parents/Children Aboard Fare Pclass Survived
Mr. Owen Harris Braund male 22 1 0 7.2500 3rd no
Mrs. John Bradley (Florence Briggs Thayer) Cumings female 38 1 0 71.2833 1st yes
Miss. Laina Heikkinen female 26 0 0 7.9250 3rd yes
Mrs. Jacques Heath (Lily May Peel) Futrelle female 35 1 0 53.1000 1st yes
Mr. William Henry Allen male 35 0 0 8.0500 3rd no
Mr. James Moran male 27 0 0 8.4583 3rd no
````` ::: ::: # Some text {background-image="https://www.purina.com.au/-/media/project/purina/main/breeds/dog/dog_boston-terrier_desktop.jpg?h=475&la=en&w=825&hash=DC3F38D08CCE086118327D827C002A62" background-size="cover"} # Math Expressions You can write LaTeX math expressions inside a pair of dollar signs, e.g. \$\alpha+\beta\$ renders $\alpha+\beta$. You can use the display style with double dollar signs: $$\bar{X}=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^nX_i$$ $$\bar{X}=\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^nX_i$$ Limitations: 1. The source code of a LaTeX math expression must be in one line, unless it is inside a pair of double dollar signs, in which case the starting `$$` must appear in the very beginning of a line, followed immediately by a non-space character, and the ending `$$` must be at the end of a line, led by a non-space character; 2. There should not be spaces after the opening `$` or before the closing `$`.. # Feeling adventurous? - Want to find out more about `quarto`? See https://quarto.org/. - You are welcomed to use the default styling of the slides. In fact, that's what I expect majority of you will do. You will differentiate yourself with the content of your presentation. - But some of you might want to play around with slide styling. This provides some solutions for this that: https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/html-themes.html.

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {

      // dispatch for htmlwidgets
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for reveal
    if (window.Reveal) {
      window.Reveal.addEventListener("slidechanged", function(event) {
        fireSlideChanged(event.previousSlide, event.currentSlide);
      });
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
